p: In December 2019, a group of patients with pneumonia have been confirmed to be infected with a novel CoV (nCoV), which was not previously observed in humans in Wuhan, the capital city of Hubei province of China [ 11- 13]. The newly discovered virus, causing a similar infection (SARS-CoV), was initially named as nCoV 2019 (January 2020) and was later called COVID-19 in February 2020. The WHO and the China Bureau had announced the discovery of a new coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2), which has been isolated from the patients suffering from pneumonia. As of February 12, 2020, a total of 43,103 cases of infection and 1,018 deaths have been recorded [ 14]. Thousands of human infections have been confirmed in China, along with many exported cases throughout the globe [ 15].
